alert.note: Alert for Delaware; Howard; Madison; Randolph; Tipton (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued December 18 at 10:58AM EST by NWS Indianapolis
info.description: ...A SNOW SHOWER WILL AFFECT NORTHERN MADISON...NORTHERN RANDOLPH... DELAWARE...SOUTHEASTERN HOWARD AND EASTERN TIPTON COUNTIES... At 1056 AM EST, a heavy snow shower was located along a line extending from near Hartford City to near Windfall. Movement was southeast at 30 mph. Winds in excess of 40 mph are possible with this snow shower. Expect quick reductions in visibility, down to 0.25 mile of visibility Locations impacted include... Muncie, Anderson, Elwood, Alexandria, Winchester, Windfall, Yorktown, Albany, Frankton, Eaton, Parker City, Farmland, Summitville, Gaston, Selma, Orestes, and Ball State University. This includes Interstate 69 between mile markers 236 and 252. Use extra caution if you must travel into or through this dangerous snow shower. Rapid changes in visibility and potentially slick roads are likely and could lead to accidents. Consider delaying travel until the squall passes your location. Conditions can deteriorate rapidly in winter weather situations. Be prepared for snow or ice covered roads. Slow down and allow extra time when traveling.
